email_subject: Broadband ISPs wise up to wireless, defend (or don't) against hackers (CNET INTERNET SERVICES)
email_body: Your ISP, if it's anything like mine, works like a very large boat: It moves slowly, it turns slowly, and sometimes it leaks. Take rogue wireless networks, for example. For many months now, some mischievous entrepreneurs have been hacking into major ISP networks and siphoning off bandwidth for neighborhood wireless networks. Only now, months later, are broadband bigwigs doing something about it. And what about ISP hackers? Could they break into your service provider? Probably. Thankfully, you can protect yourself against most of these leaks. Let Dan Tynan, our ISP guru, show you how.
